reviewText: Didn't show as much as I hoped! Not many villages shown & would have liked to have seen more countryside!
We expected something more comprehensive and fast paced.  After we visit there we will know if it captures the "Real Cornwall".

Did not work in 3 different dvd players.  It did work in one and on a computer.  We had to totally strip the video and reformat it to get it to work.  I bought this for my grandmother who is from Cornwall and I had to spend 2 weeks figuring out why it didn't work and then stripping it to get it in the correct format.

That said, if you can do all of that or you get lucky and it plays on your DVD player, it is a good video.
A nice glimpse of Cornwall.  They dwelt a bit long on the Pencarrow House at Washaway and the Tate St Ives, but it still has a nice variety and good photography.

This DVD does not play - I suspect that it was produced for UK use only. I returned it and asked for a new copy that would play - was sent the same thing.  It should not be offered as playable in America
More realistic than views from the television . I liked how it showed history of area.

This was made @ 1995 and is quite good. The history is wonderful and information about one of the port towns that makes ship replicas is incredible. I don't know if they are still building replicas, but I would LOVE to visit!
This is s very old production probably from the 70s. It almost seemed home made. We only watched a small portion of it.
brings back some memories
Very interesting but outdated,  The scenery was beautiful.
Thoroughly enjoyed it.
i enjoyed this presentation.
Love Cornwall but the film is kind of 'old' and slow.
Very informative. Beautiful scenery. Watch this before you watch Poldark series.
Lots of interesting things in Cornwall.
Cornwall is beautiful and I was hoping for a better tour of the area. I would have liked to have seen more and better photography.
Way too slow to start.
The countryside is beautiful.

What a disappointment. The couple of towns that were covered in this documentary were covered well, but I would much rather have seen a broader scope that included more towns, personalities, and variety in a superficial manner than simply leaving out most of what makes Cornwall Cornwall. An hour isn't long to summarize such a rich area, but it should have been named for the couple of towns it covered.
Ok, but not very detailed. It should've been longer to show more of the beautiful coastal villages. Cornwall is a place all it's own!
Didn't  hold my interest
Fun, watch with Doc Martin series!
informative and ineresting

I loved seeing it and will watch again. Have been watching a show called Doc Martin and he is in a town called FortWhenn. I guess it is not a real name for the place or maybe it is. Am so interested in the UK at this point in my life. I love the people and just different ways than America. Love my country but would like to learn about others. Would love to visit but in a wheelchair and would need some help. Anyway, I love Cornwall. Thanks Raven Steele.
Informative and entertaining program about the history and natural features of Cornwall.
The subject matter was good, but the video quality was terrible.
incredibly boring
dated production and the resolution is low
Sort of dated, I expected more of a  scenic tour but was disapointed
Interesting but does not provide geographical context. I know it is in the UK and it would have been nice if it explained exactly where Cornwall is via a map or some other graphic
It's an older film showing Cornwall. I felt the focused too much on individuals instead of showing more of the area.

While there are many beautiful shots of Cornwall in this DVD, much of the narration is like a school filmstrip.  I was kind of bored watching this, and I'm an Anglophile and a teacher (I love school filmstrips!)  It's okay, but not very exciting.  I just couldn't get excited about an aristocratic silver dog collar or the amount of clay that can be loaded onto a ship in six hours.
Bored me silly. In my opinion, watching paint dry would have been more entertaining.  If you're an Anglophile you'll prpobably like it.  Pour a cup, sit back...and snooze.
Some interesting history but not much for travel planning.  Rather outdated and I found the commentator's voice lacking in appeal.

I took a trip years ago to Cornwall to see where my Great grandparents lived. They moved to the copper mines of the upper peninsula of Michigan in the 1870's.  I wanted to see more of Cornwall.  This travelogue was good.  I learned a lot. Watch it.
This film is quit good and makes me want to visit this area of England. Book your trip now. Enjoy!
The beginning of the movie was good with information about the area and lovely pictures.  But it got tedious about half way through

After loving Doc Martin (especially Louisa) I was really looking  forward to a look at Cornwall. Unfortunately my Texas ears had a real hard time with the dialects. I mean a really hard time! If you can understand them this looks like an interesting show, but since I cannot I will probably watch only the first episode.

Spent way too much time on the "niceties" like touring some mansion and no time on Cornwall's fascinating history and some of the attractions attached thereto; very little time spent on the stunning beauty of the coast.

Very dated and dry.  Poor cinematography. Ignores nearly every major tourist site of Cornwall to focus on one "Great House" (which isn't that great) and a mildly interesting port village.  Not one mention of Arthurian legend sites, Truro, Port Isaac, etc.. Don't waste your time.
Quite a lovely documentary on one of the most beautiful areas of the U.K., Cornwall. Easy paced and very much makes me want to plan a trip there someday.
I love England, espcially the coastal towns, beautiful scenery, I am from Ipswich suffolk, have lived in the USA for 43 years, I miss the Seaside!  It was a very enjoyable virtual visit.
I found this to be dated and very uninspiring.  Have always wanted to visit Cornwall but not so sure after viewing this.

My constant companion, my travel coffee mug, now sports a "I love Cornwall" sticker! I visited Cornwall last year and loved every minute of my 10 days there. A beautiful part of the world with friendly people and amazing hiking!
The film was good but neglected the outdoors, the pubs, and the bike trails.
Such beautiful country and information on where to go and areas to avoid because of heavy tourism.  But I`m not sure I would want to miss any place.
Watching episodes of Doc Martin , I had an interest to watch The Real Cornwall .  It's very picturesque and full of information on the history of Cornwall . I totally enjoyed it .
Although it was informative it was somewhat disjointed.  They never used a map to give you any idea where they were in Cornwall.
I luv anything made like this from England, I'v watched this 4 times
Ok
somewhat redundant and therefore boring.  Nice scenery and not much more.
The photography is wonderful.  Even though dated at this time (2016) the information has good historic information and is narrated very well.
informative but a little boring at times
Gives many insights as to the interesting history of Cornwall.
I love this production
Very interesting.
